_description: USFL: SFL + data balancing + gradient shuffle + dynamic batch scheduler.
_section_gs: === Gradient Shuffle: mix gradients across clients to reduce bias ===
_gradient_shuffle_strategy: random | inplace (class-balanced) | average (mix with global mean) | average_adaptive_alpha (cosine similarity-based).
_gradient_shuffle_target: all: shuffle all gradients | activation_only: only activation gradients.
_gradient_average_weight: Mixing weight for 'average' strategy (0-1). 0=client only, 1=global mean only.
_section_bal: === Data Balancing: address class imbalance in Non-IID ===
_balancing_target: For 'target' strategy: mean | median | fixed number (e.g. '100').
_use_data_replication: Use max-based replication instead of min-based trimming.
_section_dbs: === Dynamic Batch Scheduler: fully utilize all client data ===
_use_dynamic_batch_scheduler: Calculate optimal per-client batch sizes to exhaust data evenly.
_use_additional_epoch: Run extra epochs to compensate for trimmed data.
_section_fresh: === Cumulative Usage & Freshness: prioritize underused data ===
_use_cumulative_usage: Track data freshness using exponential bins.
_usage_decay_factor: Per-round decay for cumulative usage (0-1). Higher = slower decay.
_use_fresh_scoring: Enable freshness-based scoring in client selection (Phase 3 of USFL selector).
_freshness_decay_rate: Decay rate for freshness score calculation.
